pullRequest.body:
This adds versions of the various Euler product statements in terms of the new topological products, namely `HasProd (fun p : Primes ‚Ü¶ ‚àë' e, f (p ^ e)) (‚àë' n, f n)` and `‚àè' p : Primes, ‚àë' e, f (p ^ e) = ‚àë' n, f n` (and similar for completely multiplicative `f` in terms of `(1 - f p)‚Åª¬π`).

At the same time, I have reworked the proofs to some extent (in particular removing a few slow `convert`s). I also added a bunch of local instances that speed up instance synthesis by a factor of 2 (from 1.4 to 0.7 seconds on my laptop).

Unfortunately, this means that the diff is fairly large.

See [here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/144837-PR-reviews/topic/L-series/near/432666616) and [here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Infinite.20products/near/431508883) on Zulip.

---

nodes.body: !bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/ecc894dd-bbda-4976-9235-c2a11b5f69e5) for commit 33b2a2be54e1b70a90505605c3dd3444a4c00c2d.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/4b08e584-6071-4a4b-aee3-4a592474441b/to/ecc894dd-bbda-4976-9235-c2a11b5f69e5) against commit bec5207fcf186349650ea23eb2b7712dfe7d59fb.

Mathlib.NumberTheory.EulerProduct.Basic	instructions:	12,643 Mrd.	-1,52 Mrd.  -12,023 % 	11,123 Mrd.
(Mrd. = 10‚Åπ)
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by loefflerd.

Thanks!

maintainer merge

Thanks for doing this! It's great to have these results for two reasons ‚Äì not just because it's the morally right generality for Euler products, but also because it's a good testing ground for whether the new `HasProd` stuff is set up as it should be.

All looks good now! 

maintainer merge

```suggestion
multiplicative on coprime arguments with `f 0 = 0`, then
```
(norm-summability is in previous line)

```suggestion
which states that `‚àè' p : Primes, (1 - f p)‚Åª¬π` converges to `‚àë' n, f n`
```

How much of a speedup is this, really? For example it takes ~350 heartbeats to synthesise a `MetrizableSpace` instance automatically; and even after manually creating the instance, it takes 205 heartbeats to look it up again. So the speedup from creating it in advance seems pretty small.
I'll check this again.

OK, there is really not that much difference. I left in one of these (which gives a speed-up of ~50ms). (Regarding the linters complaining about local instances, see [here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/270676-lean4/topic/defLemma.20and.20docBlame.20linters.20on.20local.20instances.20in.20sections/near/433824150) on Zulip.)

What happened was this. I worked on a copy of this file in a separate project to try out things, and I had two more imports there (because further below I had a copy of the contents of another file that needed them). These additional imports led to a 2x slow-down of typeclass search. When I copied my new version over to Mathlib, I left out the two imports...

(But this shows that these slow typeclass instance search problems are very sensitive to context, which is a bit problematic.)

```suggestion
      ¬∑ simp only [‚Üê (equivProdNatFactoredNumbers hpp hp).summable_iff, Function.comp_def, 
          equivProdNatFactoredNumbers_apply', factoredNumbers.map_prime_pow_mul hmul hpp hp]
```

this can all become
````
        apply Summable.mul_of_nonneg (hsum hpp) ih.1 <;>
        exact fun n ‚Ü¶ norm_nonneg _
````

```suggestion
        simp only [prod_insert hp', ‚Üê (equivProdNatFactoredNumbers hpp hp).hasSum_iff, 
          Function.comp_def, equivProdNatFactoredNumbers_apply', 
          factoredNumbers.map_prime_pow_mul hmul hpp hp]
```

This is relying on the auto-generated instance name, isn't it? That might be unwise since the auto-instance-naming algorithm currently tends to produce horrible pile-ups and is regularly being tweaked ‚Äì¬†although this name is a reasonable length, it might change as a result of those tweaks.
I'm naming the instance explicitly to avoid this.
`apply` is slightly faster

There is something strange going on in this proof, in that `Nat.Prime` is getting unfolded to `Irreducible` at some point (which is clearly rather undesirable). Ironically, this seems to be something to do with whether or not the definition `Prime` is irreducible (as a definition)! (I swear this is not a joke.)

There are actually *two* strange things; the other one is that the `Set` is turned into a `Prop`-valued function...
I have now added a rewrite that turns it back into something reasonable.

This only saves 3 heartbeats over `inferInstance`. Of these four custom instances, certainly the first three don't seem to give a significant speedup (none of them take more than 0.05sec on my laptop). For the fourth one, the automation is a little bit slower but it's still only 0.13 sec. 

This feeds into the debate we were having on zulip not long back : how much slowness are we willing to tolerate in exchange for the convenience of automation? 

(Unrelated: I wonder why the `defLemma` linter is firing on these?)
See above.

This seems annoyingly indirect, in a way which suggests that there is some API missing elsewhere (and since this PR is perhaps the first serious use of the new `HasProd` functionality, this is definitely something we should be looking out for).

The proof I was expecting, somehow, was to lift `primesBelow n` to a `Finset Primes`, and show that it tends to `atTop` wrt the partial order on finsets of primes; then the statement follows from the `HasProd` version by `Tendsto.comp`. What are we missing in order to make this approach work?

This is because `HasProd.tendsto_prod_nat` is stated only for functions with domain `‚Ñï` (this is the same as for the `HasSum` variant, so this is not specific to products).
This should be generalizable to types with an ordering satisfying suitable hypoheses, but right now I have no time to look into this in more detail.
Never mind, I had misunderstood what this proof was doing anyway (I didn't realise this was the _completely_ multiplicative version). Sorry for the noise!

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion ¬∑ simp only [‚Üê (equivProdNatFactoredNumbers hpp hp).summable_iff, Function.comp_def, ```
